Learning programme is guided by the NCF ELDAs and aim and phase specific developmental guidelines. Well-being (health), identity and belonging (social and emotional), communication, exploring mathematics, knowledge of the world, creativity.
Practitioner organises activities according to an integrated weekly and daily plan.

Programme includes a balance of  free play (indoor and outdoor), small group (scheduled times for a few children with practitioner)  and whole group activities (ring time, story, music).        Review daily schedule.
Programme includes numeracy and mathematics activities(counting - rote and with concrete resources, shapes, opportunities to compare, sort and match) and maths is used in daily events.
Programme includes language and literacy activities.

1. Children should choose their own learning activities in the classroom.

"Which one of these two statements do you agree with more?
1. Children learn best by exploring new things on their own.
2. Children learn best when new things are explained by the practitioner."

"Which one of these two statements do you agree with more? 1. If the practitioner answers childrenâ€™s questions, they will be more likely to get the correct answer. 2. If children answer their own questions, they will be more likely to understand."

"Which one of these two statements do you agree with more? 1. It is better if children tell the practitioner when they donâ€™t understand. 2. If children donâ€™t understand, they should try to find the answer independently before asking the practitioner."
